trial.text: To display {{section}} you need to activate the plan

step.title: Welcome to your account!
step.text: Our guide will help you get started with Godbot interface.

step1.text: The Trading tab provides real-time information from the AI.

step2.text: We make calculations of several assets. You can select the preferable one in this Tab.

step3.text: Each asset is calculated on multiple time frames. Choose the most suitable one for trading.

step4.text: You can see only 4 lines: forecast price, current price, and the upper and lower limits of price movements. Current price is moving along or near the forecast line in about 80% of cases. In 99% of cases the price is inside the channel. The forecast is recalculated automatically in case of significant fluctuations in the asset price or when new market input data is updated.

step5.text: Using the legend, you can enable or disable each line on the chart.

step6.text: The "Investment" tab is designed to be able to make a decision on long-term investments in assets. You can order a calculation of assets that interest you.

step7.text: In the card you can see a forecast chart of a specific asset. The current price is not pulled up and the forecast will not be updated until it is complete.

step8.text: PRO Plan allows you to request the calculation of 1 asset per month. Additional calculations you can get for the extra charge.

step9.text: In the section of trading price recommendations, you will see prices for entering and exiting a position, as well as the risks for each transaction.

step10.text: The profile card shows your plan and its expiration date.

step11.text: You can also change the theme of the website and subscribe to our pages in soical media.

accordion.title: What do the lines in GodBot forecast mean?

body.text: The red line is the projected price.
The green dotted line is the upper predicted border of the price range channel.
The blue dotted line is the lower predicted border of the price range channel.
The green line is the actual price of the asset received from the exchange.

accordion.title: How to trade with GodBot forecasts?

body.text: On the chart, you see a channel (dashed lines) and a forecast (red line).
Important!
1. We recommend entering a trade at the very beginning of the forecast.
2. Don't expect every prediction to be tradeable.
3. First of all, pay attention to the dotted lines (channel), within which the asset will move throughout the entire forecast period.
4. Pay attention to the levels!
Trading Strategies:
We have developed 2 main strategies:
Enter a position when the price reaches the upper or lower boundaries of the channel.
Under this strategy, transactions will be rarer than in the second strategy, but transactions will be of higher quality and much less risky.
Enter at the market price at the beginning of the forecast, placing take-profit and stop-loss along the channel borders.
In this case, your trades will occur frequently, but the risk in each trade will be higher.
An example of trading using the first strategy:
We place buy and sell limit orders according to the levels predicted by the GodBot neural network.
AI predicts growth, in connection with which you can place limit orders at $16,550 and $16,520, stop loss under $16,500, and take profits at $16,600, $16,750, $16,850, $16,950.
We place buy orders at the lower border of the channel at the levels: $16,800, $16,700, $16,600.
In the case of a forecast of pumps or dumps in the forecast, you can buy at market prices, but exit gradually, every couple of percent of the price movement.
An example of trading using the second strategy:
On the screen below, you see a bullish forecast of medium strength, since the upper border of the channel goes up, and the lower one is at the same level.
Another example, similar case.
In this case, it is recommended to skip the forecast, because the upper and lower boundaries of the channel are equidistant from the current price.
In the case of a forecast of pumps or dumps in the forecast, you can also buy at market prices, but exit gradually, every couple of percent of the price movement.
If the lower and upper boundaries of the channel go up at a large angle, then the forecast is very bullish and it is recommended to enter LONG.

As a rule, the forecasts are updated upon completion of the previous forecast or by the decision of the neural network, when new input data on the market appears: the release of important news, a sharp amplitude change in the price, or so on.
As a rule, AI calculates the forecast for 50-70 steps ahead, that is, with a time frame of 1 min, the forecast will be for 50-70 minutes.

accordion.title: What do the columns in the “Trading recommendations” block mean?

body.text: In the trading recommendations block you can find:

list: Winrate is the payout ratio for trades added to trading recommendations.
Signal date is the date and time of its appearance on the site.
Name is the name, ticker and icon of the coin the AI ​​recommends entering.
The order type is the trading direction.

Deal status is the status the deal is in.
- “Pending” – the forecast has been added to the site, but has not yet reached the target values ​​for the price.
- “Active” means that we have already entered the trade and if the price has already moved away from the recommended one, then it is impossible to enter.
- “Closed in profit” or “Closed by stop” – means that the transaction was closed in profit or loss.
- “Canceled” means that the trade did not approach the target price for a long time, as a result of which the AI ​​decided not to enter the asset.

body.text: Suppose we see a recommendation:

list: 12/29/22 00:32 is the date and time when the forecast was added to the site.
Bitcoin (BTC) is the ticker of the asset.
LONG is the direction of trade.
Active - the status of the transaction.
The next column is take-profit prices.
Stop Loss – set the automatic sale of the entire position at this price.

The risk per trade is the percentage of the deposit that you can lose when the stop loss is reached.
1. Calculate the average position entry price: (16530 16231)/2=16380
2. Divide the average entry price by the stop loss: (16380/15890)-1=3%
3. Divide the risk per trade by the risk resulting from the trade in the previous paragraph: 0.3%/3%=0.1
4. We multiply the resulting coefficient by the size of our deposit: 0.1*10000=1000
5. In total, we got that we need to use $1000 to enter the trade safely.

accordion.title: What time do I see on the site?

body.text: On the site you see the time according to your time zone.
Risk per trade is the percentage of your deposit that can be lost when the stop loss price is reached.
For example, if the risk per trade is 1%, then when the stop loss is reached, your deposit should decrease by no more than 1%.

We recommend that you weigh all the risks and make your own decision about futures trading.
As part of money management, we trade mostly in the spot market.

accordion.title: How to turn on candles on the chart?

body.text: To switch between the line and candles, you need to click on the gear in the "Trading" section on the home page.
In the menu that opens, select the “Real (Candle)” item.
Based on a combination of factors, we recommend the exchange Bybit or Binance.

accordion.title: Why am I not receiving emails from GodBot?

body.text: Most likely our letters end up in the Spam folder.
To change the theme, go to the user menu and click on the moon or sun icon.

accordion.title: How long do payments take to process?

body.text: Tariff activation takes from 3 to 5 minutes.
To change the tariff, you must wait until the end of the paid tariff, then select a new suitable tariff and pay for it.
At the moment, such a possibility is being worked out, but so far it is impossible to suspend the tariff.
